page.title: 15Filleigh farms survey
page.content: We made a survey of the farms in the Filleigh area. The majority of the farms keep cows, and many keep sheep, or both sheep and cows. 130 cows is the most kept on a single farm in the Filleigh area. 1 cow is the least in the Filleigh area. The rest vary between 120 and 35. Most people keep black and white cows, Friesians, on their farms and some people keep Guernseys for their richer milk to make cream with. In the morning people milk their cows between the time of 4 a.m. and 7 a.m. and in the evening people milk their cows between the time of 3 p.m. and 5.30 p.m.. Some people with just one or two cows who keep them to provide milk for themselves can milk them whenever they want. The people with herds of cows send their milk to Torrington milk centre.
